newsitem.title: USA: White Pine takes Q2 charge up to $800,000.
newsitem.headline: White Pine takes Q2 charge up to $800,000.

text.p: White Pine Software Inc said Friday it will take a $650,000-$850,000 one-time restructuring charge in the second quarter ending July 4.
The charge relates to a reorganization that will cut 26 employees, or 20 percent of the workforce, the company said.
The company's stock traded at 2-5/8 Friday morning, down 1/8 and close to its yearly low of 2.
"The reorganization will give us better control over and align our operating expenses with our current business," said acting president Killko Caballero in a statement.
White Pine's restructuring has hit home at the highest levels.

On June 4 the company named Arthur Bruno chairman, replacing Howard Berke who resigned as chairman and chief executive. Bruno served as chairman and chief executive from 1991 to 1993, prior to Berke's arrival, the company said.
White Pine said it would hire a headhunter to find a new chief executive.

On May 27 the company said it restructured its sales organization because its vice president of OEM strategic sales, Carl Koppel, was leaving to become chief executive of internet service provider ElectricVillage. Vice president of sales Bob Hadden took over Koppel's responsibilities.
On March 11 White Pine said its chief financial officer Richard Darer was leaving for Gensym Corp.

White Pine reported a net loss of 2.4 million on revenues of $2.6 million for the quarter ended April 4, compared with a $962,000 loss on revenues of $2.1 million the year before. Company officials were not immediately available to elaborate on the restructuring and management changes.
